page.title: 18WETHERBY EDUCATION PROPOSALS
page.content: Leeds Education Authority (Labour) planned, in 1984, to incorporate the 6th forms in this area into a tertiary college in Leeds. The aims were to increase falling 16+ participation rates for educational and economic reasons, to provide a flexible, adaptable tertiary provision and to provide equal openings in both education and training. Wetherby High School was included in the plans but was opposed to them as students would no longer be returning to a familiar community. Also, longer travel distances for Wetherby pupils would exclude them from many extra- curricular activities and the impersonality of a large college would inhibit curriculum and pastoral development. Consequently, the 1984 plan has been postponed to allow the Authority to consider alternatives.
